The easy way to control your home appliances
Do you want to control common household appliances and amenities from your smartphone or tablet, wherever you happen to be? Home Automation For Dummies guides you through installing and setting up appâ€“controlled devices in your home, such as heating and air conditioning, lighting, multimedia systems, game consoles, and security and monitoring devices and even suggests popular products to consider.

The saturation of the mobile market with smart devices has led to an upsurge in domestic devices, such as thermostats, refrigerators, smoke detectors, security systems, among others, that can be controlled by those devices. Both Google and Apple offer fullyâ€“integrated solutions for connecting mobile devices to home theater and audio systems, and now Google has branched out into smart thermostats and smoke detectors. If youâ€²ve caught the bug and want to get your feet wet in this cool new phenomenon, Home Automation For Dummies gives you plainâ€“English, stepâ€“byâ€“step instructions for techâ€“ifying your home without breaking a sweat.

* Shows you how to set preferences to automatically adjust lighting or temperature

* Explores digital "life hacks" that explain how nonâ€“appâ€“ready appliances can be controlled via smart phones using thirdâ€“party goâ€“betweens
